newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel's M1 money supply up 2.3 percent in April.
newsitem.headline: Israel's M1 money supply up 2.3 percent in April.

text.p: Israel's M1 money supply rose a preliminary 2.3 percent in April to 18.12 billion shekels, the Bank of Israel said on Sunday.
The rise followed a revised 1.8 percent decline in March and 2.6 percent increase in February. April brought the cumulative increase since the start of the year to 6.6 percent.

The relatively steep increase in M1 followed last Thursday's announcement of an unexpectedly low April consumer price index, which has led some analysts to predict that the Bank of Israel will lower interest rates later this month. The central bank is due to announce June interest rates on May 26.
The Bank of Israel said total credit rose 1.6 percent in April to 267.3 billion shekels following a 0.9 percent increase in March and 2.5 percent rise in April 1996.
In the first four months of 1997, total credit rose 5.4 percent, it added.

Unlinked shekel credit rose 1.5 percent in April to 82 billion shekels, following a 1.6 percent March decline and a 3.7 percent rise in April 1996. In the four months, unlinked credit rose one percent.
